topics.body:
I was reading about dogs and Muslims in Islamic religion.
And I am quite surprised.

The prophet never hated dogs. In fact, he took care of them. He would feed stray dogs and even protected a dog feeding her young during the invasion of Makkah and yet, Muslims see dogs as filthy creatures and are disgusted by them.

What happened?
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

Honestly probably the reason why Christianity gained popularity was because they assimilated Paganism into them.  Considering that paganism is becoming popular again they can't realistically assimilate them again.

That would be interesting to see, "Welcome to church; Sunday morning we have a worship service to Yahweh and Sunday afternoon we have a worship service to Odin"

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55346aae6368727bfc1c0800#post_55346aae6368727bfc1c0800
Yes and no. When it comes to any kind of art you NEED to be hard on yourself. You need to be your own worst critic. That's how you improve. You see what you did wrong in one work and then you fix it in another. The moment you become content with your skill level is the moment you stagnate. That being said, you can't discourage yourself either. You have to kick yourself in the butt. FORCE yourself if you have to.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff
